title: "Chant Anyway" by Srila Bhaktivinod Thakur | Soulful Japa
speaker: HDG Srila Prabhupada

segments.text: I will put one writing of Bhaktivinoda Thakur. You read that. Then you will see how we should
be towards, how our attitude should be towards general population chanting Hare Krishna.
This is Bhaktivinoda Thakur's Sharanagati quoted from Adi Purana. It's called chant
anyway. It starts like this. Your mind is wandering all over the universe when you chant.
Chant anyway. Your mind is wandering to the past and future when you chant. Chant anyway.
You are not able to concentrate on Krishna's names while you chant. Chant anyway. You have
no taste for chanting. Chant anyway. You have lusty desires. Chant anyway. You are making
offences in chanting. Chant anyway.
You are not praying to Krishna to help you chant better. Chant anyway. You often chant
late at night. Chant anyway.
And why, why should you chant despite all the above obstacles? That is why. What is
that? There is no vow like chanting the Holy Name. There's no knowledge superior to it.
There is no meditation which comes anywhere near it and it gives the highest result. No
penance is in it.
